humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report mentions that there are two foci of invasive ductal carcinoma, one spanning 28 mm and the other 2 mm. The T stage is determined by the size of the largest tumor, which in this case is 28 mm. According to the rules provided, a tumor of this size falls under the T2 category, which includes tumors that are more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The T stage of a cancer is determined by the size of the primary tumor. In this report, it is stated that the invasive ductal carcinoma spans 28 mm and 2 mm. The larger focus of 28 mm puts the tumor in the T2 stage, which includes tumors with a size of 20 mm to 50 mm. Therefore, the T stage from this report is T2.
